newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran protests to Azerbaijan on prisoner treatment.
newsitem.headline: Iran protests to Azerbaijan on prisoner treatment.

text.p: Iran on Wednesday protested to neighbouring Azerbaijan over alleged bad conditions for Iranians held in Azeri prisons, the Iranian news agency IRNA said.

It said Azerbaijan's ambassador in Tehran was summoned to the Iranian foreign ministry where an official told him that "conditions of Iranian detainees in Azeri jails should meet international conventions".
Iranian officials said last month that three Iranians had died in Azerbaijani jails due to poor prison conditions. Azeri officials rejected the allegations.
The protest came as ties between the two countries appeared to be worsening despite their growing cooperation in oil.
Baku last month stopped daily retransmissions of Iranian television programmes over what it called was "interference in its internal politics" and "one-side propaganda".
Islamic Iran's media and some Tehran officials have criticised Azerbaijan's secular and pro-Western policies, including Baku's ties with Israel.
Baku, developing huge offshore oil resources, has in the past accused Tehran of wanting to overthrow its government and replace it with an Islamist pro-Iranian one.
Four members of Azerbaijan's banned Islamic party were given long prison terms this year for allegedly spying for Iran. Tehran denied the charges.
